data.title: Film Genres
data.meta_description: Film Genres - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
1. Film Genres Lecture prepared 11/16/08 by John M. Grace, film worker and instructor D.A.T.A. Charter High School Albuquerque, NM © 2008, John M. Grace All Rights Reserved for use availability, email Newestprod@aol.com

2. Film Genres Film genres are identifiable types, categories, classifications or groups of films that have similar techniques or conventions such as: content subject matter structures themes mood period plot settings recurring icons stock characters narrative events situations motifs styles props stars

3. Film Genres Primary film genres include the following: Action Films Adventure Films Comedy Films Crime Films Dramas Epics Horror Films Musicals Science Fiction War Films Westerns

4. Sub-genres Are identifiable sub-classes within the larger film genre, with their own distinctive subject matter, style, formulas, and iconography.

5. Film Genres ACTION: Action films usually include high energy, big-budget physical stunts and chases, possibly with rescues, battles, fights, escapes, races against time and crises featuring non-stop motion, break-neck rhythm and pacing.

6. Action Sub-genres spy espionage political thrillers martial arts films races against time

7. Action Sub-genres spy espionage political thrillers martial arts films races against time

8. Action Sub-genres spy espionage political thrillers martial arts films races against time

9. Action Sub-genres spy espionage political thrillers martial arts films races against time

10. Action Sub-genres spy espionage political thrillers martial arts films races against time

11. Film Genres ADVENTURE: Adventure films are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales, very similar to or often paired with the Action film genre.

12. Adventure Sub-genres swashbucklers serialized films historical epics expedition films treasure hunts disaster films strange mysteries

13. Adventure Sub-genres swashbucklers serialized films historical epics expedition films treasure hunts disaster films strange mysteries

19. Film Genres COMEDY: Comedies are light-hearted plots deliberately designed to amuse and provoke laughter by exaggerating the situation, language, action, relationships and characters.

20. Comedy Sub-genres slapstick screwball spoofs parodies romantic comedies black comedy satirical comedy

21. Comedy Sub-genres slapstick screwball spoofs parodies romantic comedies black comedy satirical comedy

27. Film Genres CRIME: Crime films feature the sinister actions of criminals, mobsters, bank robbers, underworld figures, and ruthless hoodlums who operate outside the law, stealing and murdering their way through life.

28. Crime Sub-genres gangster films detective films film noir mysteries serial killer films suspense films thrillers courtroom dramas

29. Crime Sub-genres gangster films detective films film noir mysteries serial killer films suspense films thrillers courtroom dramas

30. Crime Sub-genres gangster films detective films film noir mysteries serial killer films suspense films thrillers courtroom dramas

35. Crime Sub-genres gangster films detective films film noir mysteries serial killer films suspense films thrillers courtroom dramas

36. Film Genres DRAMA: Dramas are serious, plot-driven films, portraying realistic characters, settings, life situations, and stories involving intense character development and interaction.

37. Drama Sub-genres melodramas romance biographical films 'adult' films sports films road movies “ guy” films

38. Drama Sub-genres melodramas romance biographical films 'adult' films sports films road movies “ guy” films

44. Film Genres EPICS: Epics take an historical or imagined event, mythic, legendary, or heroic figure, and add an extravagant setting and lavish costumes, accompanied by grandeur and spectacle, dramatic scope, high production values, and a sweeping musical score.

45. Epic Sub-genres historical dramas costume dramas war films medieval romps period pictures adventure films religious films

46. Epic Sub-genres historical dramas costume dramas war films medieval romps period pictures adventure films religious films

47. Epic Sub-genres historical dramas costume dramas war films medieval romps period pictures adventure films religious films

51. Epic Sub-genres historical dramas costume dramas war films medieval romps period pictures adventure films religious films

52. Film Genres HORROR: Horror films are designed to frighten and to invoke our hidden worst fears, often in a terrifying, shocking finale, while captivating and entertaining us at the same time in a cathartic experience.

53. Horror Sub-genres slasher science fiction supernatural teen terror serial killers satanic monsters

54. Horror Sub-genres slasher science fiction supernatural teen terror serial killers satanic monsters

55. Horror Sub-genres slasher science fiction supernatural teen terror serial killers satanic monsters

60. Film Genres MUSICALS: Musicals/dance films are cinematic forms that emphasize full-scale scores or song and dance routines in a significant way, or they are films that are centered on combinations of music, dance, song or choreography.

61. Musicals Sub-genres Broadway musicals musical comedy concert films performance films music biographies

62. Musicals Sub-genres Broadway musicals musical comedy concert films performance films music biographies

63. Musicals Sub-genres Broadway musicals musical comedy concert films performance films music biographies

64. Musicals Sub-genres Broadway musicals musical comedy concert films performance films music biographies

65. Musicals Sub-genres Broadway musicals musical comedy concert films performance films music biographies

66. Film Genres SCIENCE FICTION: Sci-fi films are often quasi-scientific, visionary and imaginative - complete with heroes, aliens, distant planets, quests, fantastic places, new technology, and extraordinary monsters. Sci-fi films often feature multiple genres.

67. Sci-Fi Sub-genres futuristic films visionary horrific graphic novels medical miseries devil machines mad science space invaders

68. Sci-Fi Sub-genres futuristic films visionary horrific graphic novels medical miseries devil machines mad science space invaders

73. Sci-Fi Sub-genres futuristic films visionary horrific graphic novels medical miseries devil machines mad science space invaders

74. Film Genres WAR MOVIES: War films acknowledge the horror and heartbreak of war, letting the actual combat fighting (against nations or humankind) on land, sea, or in the air provide the primary plot or background action for the of the film.

75. War Sub-genres war dramas military operations anti-war films POW stories military training

76. War Sub-genres war dramas military operations anti-war films POW stories military training

77. War Sub-genres war dramas military operations anti-war films POW stories military training

78. War Sub-genres war dramas military operations anti-war films POW stories military training

79. War Sub-genres war dramas military operations anti-war films POW stories military training

80. Film Genres WESTERNS: Westerns are the major defining genre of the American film industry - a eulogy to the early days of the expansive American frontier. They are one of the oldest, most enduring genres with very recognizable plots, elements, and characters.

81. Western Sub-genres epic Western the 'singing cowboy' the "spaghetti" Western contemporary Western revisionist Western comedy Western "post-apocalyptic"
